title: Document-level Event-based Extraction Using Generative Template-filling Transformers.
abstract:
We revisit the classic information extraction problem of document-level
template filling. We argue that sentence-level approaches are ill-suited to the
task and introduce a generative transformer-based encoder-decoder framework
that is designed to model context at the document level: it can make extraction
decisions across sentence boundaries; is \emph{implicitly} aware of noun phrase
coreference structure, and has the capacity to respect cross-role dependencies
in the template structure. We evaluate our approach on the MUC-4 dataset, and
show that our model performs substantially better than prior work. We also show
that our modeling choices contribute to model performance, e.g., by implicitly
capturing linguistic knowledge such as recognizing coreferent entity mentions.
Our code for the evaluation script and models will be open-sourced at
https://github.com/xinyadu/doc_event_entity for reproduction purposes.
